title: Back-end Developer
description: Advanced the e-health platform as a Backend Developer, improving mental health service delivery in the Netherlands for over 3 years.

content.content: As a key member of the software development team at Therapieland B.V., we advanced our e-health SaaS platform, providing mental health services in the Netherlands.

items: Led the final phase of the script responsible for reshaping and moving hundreds of millions of rows of data efficiently, utilizing Python, SQL, NumPy, and Pandas.

Emphasized TDD, software architecture, design patterns, and code principles, resulting in 95% test coverage, rapid implementation of critical features late in the project, no major refactors, and minimal post-launch issues.
Reduced runtime from two weeks to 12 hours through advanced SQL and Pandas optimization.
Developed and maintained large backend systems using Python and Django, ensuring efficient database management with Django ORM, PostgreSQL, and Redis.
Managed server operations on GCP and Linux, overseeing application deployments using Kubernetes, Docker, and GitLab Pipelines.
Identified and mitigated major cybersecurity vulnerabilities, preventing potential data breaches and addressing other significant security concerns.
Contributed to both the legacy platform and the new platform built with Vue.js. Including the communication between systems through RESTful APIs

title: Front-end Developer
description: Developed a responsive website showcasing eco-friendly maritime initiatives, featuring an interactive map and dynamic content management using WordPress.

content.content: This project showcased environmentally friendly maritime initiatives across the Netherlands.

items: Implemented a user-friendly front-end, ensuring the website's responsiveness and interactive features such as a map view and dynamic card listings.
Developed the back-end infrastructure using WordPress, facilitating easy content management and configuration for non-technical users.
Worked closely with designers to translate visual concepts into functional web components, maintaining consistency to the initial design specifications.

title: Lead Developer
description: Led the development of an interactive web application for visualizing maritime emissions.

items: Managed the project's entire lifecycle, from drafting detailed business proposals and negotiating contracts to overseeing product delivery.
Developed and deployed the applicationâ€™s front-end and back-end using Python and Django, integrating complex data visualization features that enhance user interaction.
Delivered a user-centric web application that significantly improved clients' understanding of maritime emissions, tailored to various ship types, maritime routes, and propulsion types.
The successful execution and client satisfaction with the project led to further engagements, securing two additional projects with the client.
